required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of QL1604 Plus Nab-paclitaxel Versus Paclitaxel in Subjects With Advanced Gastric Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of QL1604 Plus Nab-paclitaxel Versus Paclitaxel for Participants With Advanced Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma That Progressed After Therapy With Platinum and Fluoropyrimidine

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study for participants with advanced gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma who had tumor progression after first-line treatment with platinum and fluoropyrimidine doublet therapy. The study will be conducted in 2 parts.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The first stage is a single-arm clinical trial, and the second stage is a controlled clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence and severity of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE) according to CTCAE V5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days from last dose

primary_outcome.measure: The percentages of participants discontinuing or suspending the study drug due to an AE.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days from last dose
from the date of first dose until the date of death from any cause,assessed up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time from randomization to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate（ORR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1（stage 1 and 2）
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate（ORR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease control rate（DCR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1（stage 1 and 2）
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate（DCR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival（PFS）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1（stage 1 and 2）
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival（PFS）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor response rate（TRR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1（stage 1 and 2）
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor response rate（TRR）assessed by the investigators according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of first dose until the date of death from any cause,assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time from randomization to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC ) following single dose administration of PD-1（stage 1 ）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC ) following single dose administration of PD-1

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak plasma concentration (Cmax) following single dose administration of PD-1（stage 1 ）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration (Cmax) following single dose administration of PD-1

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady-state trough serum concentration of multiple Dose Administration of PD-1（stage 2）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state trough serum concentrationof multiple Dose Administration of PD-1

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady-state peak serum concentration of multiple Dose Administration of PD-1（stage 2）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state peak serum concentration of multiple Dose Administration of PD-1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: The titer of anti-drug antibodies (ADA)and neutralizing antibodies(Nab).

clinical_study.condition: Advanced Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma

arm_group.description: Participants receive QL1604 and nab-paclitaxel on Days 1, 8, and 15 of each 28-day cycle. If not disease progression after 4 cycles, participants receive QL1604 monotherapy until disease progression、unacceptable toxicity or up to 2 years.

Participants receive QL1604 and nab-paclitaxel on Days 1, 8, and 15 of each 28-day cycle. If not disease progression after 4 cycles, participants receive QL1604 monotherapy until disease progression、unacceptable toxicity or up to 2 years.
Participants receive paclitaxel on Days 1, 8, and 15 of each 28-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
